dom-notification-actions.summary: The actions read-only property of the Notification interface returns the list of NotificationAction objects set using the actions option when creating the notification using the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-actions.title: Notification.actions

dom-notification-actions.summary: Returns the string ID of the notification button the user clicked. This value returns an empty string if the user clicked the notification somewhere other than an action button, or the notification does not have a button. The notification id is set during the creation of the Notification via the actions array attribute and can't be modified unless the notification is replaced.

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-notification-actions.title: NotificationEvent.action

dom-notification-badge.summary: The badge property of the Notification interface returns the URL of the image used to represent the notification when there is not enough space to display the notification itself.
dom-notification-badge.title: Notification.badge

dom-notification-body.summary: The body read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the body string of the notification, as specified in the body option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-body.title: Notification.body

dom-notification-data.summary: The data read-only property of the Notification interface returns a structured clone of the notification's data, as specified in the data option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-data.title: Notification.data

dom-notification-dir.summary: The dir read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the text direction of the notification, as specified in the dir option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-dir.title: Notification.dir

dom-notification-icon.summary: The icon read-only property of the Notification interface contains the URL of an icon to be displayed as part of the notification, as specified in the icon option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-icon.title: Notification.icon

dom-notification-lang.summary: The lang read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the text direction of the notification, as specified in the lang option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-lang.title: Notification.lang

dom-notification-notificationtitle-optio.summary: The Notification() constructor creates a new Notification object instance, which represents a user notification.
dom-notification-notificationtitle-optio.title: Notification.Notification()

dom-notification-onclick.summary: The onclick property of the Notification interface specifies an event listener to receive click events. These events occur when the user clicks on a displayed Notification.
dom-notification-onclick.title: Notification.onclick

dom-notification-onerror.summary: The onerror property of the Notification interface specifies an event listener to receive error events. These events occur when something goes wrong with a Notification (in many cases an error preventing the notification from being displayed.)
dom-notification-onerror.title: Notification.onerror

dom-notification-permission.summary: The permission read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the current permission granted by the user for the current origin to display web notifications.
dom-notification-permission.title: Notification.permission

dom-notification-renotify.summary: The renotify read-only property of the Notification interface specifies whether the user should be notified after a new notification replaces an old one, as specified in the renotify option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-renotify.title: Notification.renotify

dom-notification-requireinteraction.summary: The requireInteraction read-only property of the Notification interface returns a Boolean indicating that a notification should remain active until the user clicks or dismisses it, rather than closing automatically.
dom-notification-requireinteraction.title: Notification.requireInteraction

dom-notification-silent.summary: The silent read-only property of the Notification interface specifies whether the notification should be silent, i.e., no sounds or vibrations should be issued, regardless of the device settings. This is specified in the renotify option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-silent.title: Notification.silent

dom-notification-tag.summary: The tag read-only property of the Notification interface signifies an identifying tag for the notification, as specified in the tag option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-tag.title: Notification.tag

dom-notification-timestamp.summary: The timestamp read-only property of the Notification interface returns a DOMTimeStamp, as specified in the timestamp option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-timestamp.title: Notification.timestamp

dom-notification-title.summary: The title read-only property of the Notification interface indicates the title of the notification, as specified in the title parameter of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-title.title: Notification.title

dom-notification-vibrate.summary: The vibrate read-only property of the Notification interface specifies a a vibration pattern for the device's vibration hardware to emit when the notification fires. This is specified in the vibrate option of the Notification() constructor.
dom-notification-vibrate.title: Notification.vibrate

dom-notificationevent-notification.summary: The notification read-only property of the NotificationEvent interface returns the instance of the Notification that was clicked to fire the event. The Notification provides read-only access to many properties that were set at the instantiation time of the Notification such as tag and data attributes that allow you to store information for defered use in the notificationclick event.

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-notificationevent-notification.title: NotificationEvent.notification

dom-notificationevent-notificationeventt.summary: The NotificationEvent() constructor creates a new NotificationEvent object.

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-notificationevent-notificationeventt.title: NotificationEvent.NotificationEvent()

dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.summary: The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick property is an event handler called whenever the notificationclick event is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope object, that is when a user clicks on a displayed notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.title: ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick

dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.summary: The ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclose property is an event handler called whenever the notificationclose event is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope object, that is when a user closes a displayed notification spawned by ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-serviceworkerglobalscope-onnotificat.title: onnotificationclose

dom-serviceworkerregistration-getnotific.summary: The getNotifications() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface returns a list of the notifications in the order that they were created from the current origin via the current service worker registration. Origins can have many active but differently-scoped service worker registrations. Notifications created by one service worker on the same origin will not be available to other active services workers on that same origin.

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-serviceworkerregistration-getnotific.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.getNotifications()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.summary: The showNotification() method of the ServiceWorkerRegistration interface creates a notification on an active service worker.
dom-serviceworkerregistration-shownotifi.title: ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification()

image-resource.summary: The image read-only property of the Notification interface contains the URL of an image to be displayed as part of the notification
image-resource.title: Notification.image

notificationevent.summary: The parameter passed into the onnotificationclick handler, the NotificationEvent interface represents a notification click event that is dispatched on the ServiceWorkerGlobalScope of a ServiceWorker.

firefox.notes: Service workers (and Push) have been disabled in the Firefox 45 and 52 Extended Support Releases (ESR).

notificationevent.title: NotificationEvent
